place.name: IVYCHURCH
place.gazetteerText: IVY-CHURCH, or IVECHURCH, a parish in RomneyMarsh district, Kent; 3 miles NW of New Romney, and 3½ ESE of Appledore r. station. Post town, New Romney, under Folkestone. Acres, 4, 542. Real property, £12, 515. Pop., 273. Houses, 50. The land is chiefly pasture. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Canterbury. Value, £450.* Patron, the Archbishop of Canterbury. The church consists of nave, aisles, and chancel, with embattled tower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
